1 \defgroup file-based-session-storage File-Based Session Storage
2 \ingroup session-storage
3 
4 \details
5 
6 File-Based Session Storage keeps incoming and outgoing messages and session's state data in files in
7 the OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionSettings::storageDirectory folder.
8 
9 For each FIXP session the following files are created:
10 
11 - `SESSION_NAME.state` contains session state data (OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::sessionVerId,
12 OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::negotiated, OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::inSeqNum, OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::outSeqNum, etc.).
13 - `SESSION_NAME.summary` contains [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) encoded binary SBE messages.
14 To decode these messages, use the \ref sbe-log-decoder-sample from the Handler distribution package.
15 
16 `SESSION_NAME` is formed on the base of OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::id, OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionSettings::enteringFirm
17 and a timestamp. It is available via the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::storageId method.
18 
19 \section file-based-storage-segmented Segmented File-Based Storage
20 
21 Sometimes it is needed to save space on disk, and there is no need to keep the whole history of incoming and outgoing messages.
22 File-Based Storage could be configured to store messages in a set of `.summary` files, instead of a single one.
23 The entire collection of logged messages is split through several files
24 called "segments", and older segments could be archived.
25 
26 The Segmented mode of the File-based Storage is activated when
27 the OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionSettings::fileBasedStorageSegmentSize(Messaging::UInt64 value) is set to a positive value.
28 
29 Segments are named as `StorageID[-part-N].summary`, where:
30 
31 - `StorageID` - the generic ID of storage (available via the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::storageId method);
32 - `-part-N` - the segment suffix. The `N` is the 1-based number of segments. One segment does not have this suffix
33 - it is the segment where the newest messages are stored.
34 
35 During the session lifetime, new segment files are created per the following algorithm:
36 
37 - A new message is saved to the `StorageID.summary` file;
38 - When the message is saved, the `StorageID.summary` file size is compared to
39 - the SessionSettings::fileBasedStorageSegmentSize value, and if the actual file size exceeds this value,
40 a new segment is created;
41 - To create a new segment, the Handler renames `StorageID.summary` to `StorageID-part-N.summary` and creates
42 a new empty `StorageID.summary` file to store subsequent messages.
43 - The `N` is a sequential number of parts starting from `1`.
44 
45 So during a long session, a set of files could be created: `StorageID.summary`, `StorageID-part-1.summary`,
46 `StorageID-part-2.summary`, etc.
47 Oldest messages are stored in the `StorageID-part-1.summary` file, and newer ones - in the `StorageID.summary`
48 and `StorageID-part-N.summary` files, where `N` is the maximum value.
49 
50 The number of segments is recorded in the `StorageID.state` file after the `FilePartCount` key.
51 For instance, if there are `5` segments, (`StorageID.summary`, `StorageID-part-1.summary`, ... , `StorageID-part-4.summary`)
52 the following line will be stored in the `StorageID.state` file:
53 
54  FilePartCount=5
